page.title: 12Lowfields Farm
page.content: Lowfields farm is owned by Mr and Mrs Wright. On their hundred and fifty acres they grow wheat, spring and winter barley and sugar beet. They also keep a beef herd and have one Hereford bull which is ten years old. They breed chickens and geese but have a problem with a fox. Mr Wright and his wife employ no other labour and work the farm alone. They have two sons at school who help during the holidays. They have a dog called Skip who catches all the rats. There are five tractors used on the farm, all for different purposes. The farm has recently lost twelve acres owing to the new Lincoln by-pass being built across the land. This has made access difficult because it has cut his farm land in two.
